intro: Achatocarpus praecox var. praecox, commonly known as the early flowering achatocarpus, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain several seeds, typical of the genus Achatocarpus. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or disturbed areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems.
